Articles.Content:
So got a kerbal manned craft orbiting sun at max distance. Its a 69 year journey.

Those two brave kerbals!
Follow it in real time, and post screenshots at regular intervals

Even better. Follow it in real time and post a picture when you reach Apoapsis. Funny to think that if you were 40 and you did this, odds are, you would DIE before you would hit Apoapsis in a video game! lol

Ill'd rather not do it in real time.

But ill post when at Apotheosis.
What happened to the third guy? Did they run out of food?

What happened to the third guy? Did they run out of food?

Maybe he popped outside for some fresh air
I believe this pod only holds two guys.
It's impossible to reach the 68yr mark, it's a glitch. You've escaped the sun.

What happened to the third guy? Did they run out of food?

Since when did kerbals become cannibals LOL.

It's impossible to reach the 68yr mark, it's a glitch. You've escaped the sun.

Actually, if that was the case, it would say "sun escape". He's not quite reached solar escape velocity, he will, EVENTUALLY, return.
You may want to rethink that plan. Assuming your periapsis is around kerbins altitude, that orbit has a period of roughly 140 years kerbin time. That will take a while.. even on max time warp.

Actually, if that was the case, it would say "sun escape". He's not quite reached solar escape velocity, he will, EVENTUALLY, return.

Some centuries later, the Kerbals are finally sending their first interstellar mission.....when the return of the errant space mission goes horrifically to plan.

*WHAM*

HA um when i now go to the flight the time warp is broken like it doesn't work or do anything i predict its because of the amount of information going on. So its now a real lofe time wait of 67 years!!!!!!!!!!!! My goal was to get to the maxium distance but ill be too old then LOL. I am sure there will be a solution.

Launch a second mission. Use its time warp to speed up the original mission's voyage.

Done!
